title: Transformations
text: Think about the kinds of transformations that are occuring.

title: Equation
text: Think about the equation in the form of $${\left(a \left(x+b\right)\right)}^2+k$$

title: Vertical Transformation
text: Which variable represents the vertical transformation?

title: Vertical Transformation
text: Since k represents the vertical transformation, what is k in our case?

title: Vertical Transformation
text: Since our k is $$1$$, is this a vertical shift up or down?

title: Up Transformation
text: It is a vertical shift up by $$1$$, since our k is $$1$$.

title: Horizontal Transformation
text: Which variable represents the horizontal transformation?

title: Horizontal Transformation
text: Since $$b$$ represents the horizontal transformation, what is $$b$$ in our case?

title: Horizontal Transformation
text: Since our $$b$$ is $$-2$$, is this a horizontal shift to the left or right?

title: Right Transformation
text: It is a horizontal shift to the right by $$2$$, since $$b$$ is $$-2$$.

title: Width
text: Which variable represents the width of our graph?

title: Width
text: Since a represents the width of our graph, what is a in this case?

title: Width
text: Since a is $$1$$, what does that tell us about the width? Will it be skinnier, wider, or normal?

title: Normal Width
text: Since a is $$1$$, it will have a normal width.
